description: Third pass of influence analysis: samples and annotates relevant passages from the cited thinkers' actual works. Gathers evidence for hypothesis verification in Pass 4.
researcher_question: What do the cited thinkers actually say about the topics the author invokes them for?

samples.hypothesis_id: string - which hypothesis this samples for
samples.source_work: string - title of the source work
samples.passage: string - the relevant passage (quoted or summarized)
samples.relevance: string - why this passage is relevant to the hypothesis

thinkers_with_texts: string - thinkers whose works were available
thinkers_without_texts: string - thinkers whose works were not available

extraction.core_question: What passages from the original thinkers are relevant to our hypotheses?
extraction_steps: REVIEW HYPOTHESES: Consider each hypothesis from Pass 2
IDENTIFY RELEVANT WORKS: Determine which source texts to consult
LOCATE PASSAGES: Find passages relevant to the hypothesis
QUOTE OR SUMMARIZE: Extract the key content
ASSESS INITIAL RELEVANCE: Note how the passage bears on the hypothesis
extraction.special_instructions: Quote directly when possible. Be accurate about source locations. If texts are unavailable, note this clearly. Sample broadly - get multiple passages per hypothesis when possible.
